    Kuikui Liu

    Assistant Professor, MIT EECS

    • Stata Center: 32-D632
    • liukui [at] mit [dot] edu

    I am a mathematician/computer scientist in the Theory Group at MIT EECS, where I hold the Elting Morison Career Development Chair. I was previously a FODSI postdoctoral fellow at MIT CSAIL hosted by Ankur Moitra. I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Washington, where I was extremely fortunate to be advised by Shayan Oveis Gharan. I am interested in the design and analysis of sampling algorithms for high-dimensional probability distributions. I like thinking about Markov chain mixing times, statistical physics, and the geometry of polynomials.

    My dissertation can be found here.

    I am currently working with the following excellent graduate students:

    • Francisco Pernice (coadvised with David Gamarnik)
    • Amit Rajaraman (coadvised with Sam Hopkins)
    • Daniel Lee
